page.title: 09FARMING.
page.content: Well renowned as a Stock Rearing area and although larger proprotion than ever before is devoted to Arable Crops there is still a large amount of {Livestock.}Cattle - Dairy Herds mainly Freisians. Beef herds mainly Herefords,Charolais and Limousin generally crossed with Freisians and reared as stores for sale in and outside the area or as Fat Cattle. Sheep are also bred and reared as stores,to be sold fat or reared as replacement stock, the latter usually from pedigree flocks. A few pigs and poultry are also kept. {Arable.}Wheat, barley oats, oil seed rape and potatoes,with peas, beans and vegetables providing 'Break' crops. {Grassland.}Permanent and temporary leys are grown and used for grazing or for making hay and silage.
